messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Window messages
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know if I have that one, but I have a few other great ones from Mark Twain! Tanya Simpson bingoqueen@sssnet.com Used books, textbooks and workbooks
messages.messageBody:
I don't know if I have that one, but I have a few other great ones from Mark Twain!
Tanya Simpson

Used books, textbooks and workbooks
http://www.geocities.com/athomemamaof5/opening_page_sales.html

"The people who oppose your ideas are inevitably those who represent the established order that your ideas will upset."
-Anthony D'Angelo
----- Original Message -----
From: Tia Leschke
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, August 18, 2002 6:47 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Window messages



>
>This might be a little long, but my favorite quote is "Education is not the
>filling of a bucket, but the lighting of a fire."

How about Mark Twain's, "Don't let school interfere with your education."
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Window messages
messages.msgSnippet: I put that one up today! I found a site that had tons of quotes on them that are all great! painting backwards is a bit tricky, I had to write it with marker
messages.messageBody:
I put that one up today!
I found a site that had tons of quotes on them that are all great!
painting backwards is a bit tricky, I had to write it with marker on the outside then paint from the inside!
I think I will make some daisies too!
at halloween we did some great pictures for that too!

Tanya Simpson
bingoqueen@...

http://www.geocities.com/athomemamaof5/opening_page_sales.html

"The people who oppose your ideas are inevitably those who represent the established order that your ideas will upset."
-Anthony D'Angelo
----- Original Message -----
From: Bj4kids@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, August 18, 2002 5:20 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Window messages


That is funny about all your windows to fill with messages..

How about Gatto's famous one?
"Are you dumbed down, yet?"
OR
"Have you dumbed down a kid today?"

Okay, enough of that, huh?
I am a public educator, believe it or not. (of course, that is the reason are
kids are unschooled...)
Most educators think schooling at home is the enemy.
I tried thinking of a message to put and haven't thought of one yet that
really would send the message..
But, I do know this is a needed message..

SMILE AND HAVE MORE FUN!!!!!!

OR

Throw the chairs away for a day!!!!

OR

Have you heard yourself laugh today?

OR

Has a kid had fun today?

OR

Got fun?

OR

Hug a lunch lady today.

Or
Hug a kid today!

Okay, I will quite rambling
Bj


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
